help-file.title: SOCIETY
help-file.content:
Association Command
Syntax: society <s>ubcommands argumentlist
(Subcommands can be accessed by just using the first letter.)
List of subcommands -------------------
society soc -displays a list of members and various info about them depending on your rank. Members higher in rank than you are only shown if online. Also displays some info on the association to higher ranks. Finally it gives a list of people ostracized by your association.
society apply member soc a Hero -applies to the (senior or higher) member Hero of an association for membership in his association. soc a me -clears an existing application to an association.
society enroll applicant soc e Newone -enrolls Newone to the association, if he has applied for membership first.
society kickout member soc k Twink -kicks member Twink out of the association, erasing his name in the member list. Is also used to delete names from the ostracism list.
society secede [confirm] soc s -just displays a warning message that "soc s confirm" has to be typed soc s confirm -the member leaves the association. All his data is erased from the member list -except if he was a declared enemy. Then he is automatically put on the ostracism list.
society ostracize name soc o Anti -puts the name "Anti" on the ostracism list. The association's guards will then attack any person with the name "Anti" as if they had the rank enemy in the association.
society rank name change soc r Lucky 2 -the member Lucky is promoted by two ranks. soc r Noluck -3 -the member Noluck is demoted by three ranks. Note that the minimum mortal rank obtainable with this normal (member) and the maximum is leader.
society punish name soc p Arrggh -the first punish puts member Arrggh on parole. soc p Arrggh -the second one declares Arrggh as enemy, thus making the association guards aggressive to him. The rank subcommand (see above) can be used to reinstate Arrggh, but only a leader can do this once he is of enemy rank.
society challenge member soc c Bigger -(this is not allowed by all association) this challenges a member of the next higher rank for his position. This is a political command, there is no auto-attack. The outcome of the challenge depends mainly on experience and the looser faces tough penalties.
society name rank_keyword new_rank_name soc n enemy Hunted by -the new rank name of the enemy rank is "Hunted by". A list of rank_keywords and current names for them is shown to the leader with the "soc" list. soc n l Master of -the rank keywords can be abbreviated as well, here "l" stands for leader rank, now called "Master of". soc n normal -without a new rank name, the rank name is wiped and in the title only the association name is shown. ANSI can be used in rank names. Note that the association name is pasted directly behind the rank name, so often a trailing space is necessary in the given rank name.
society home soc h -set your hometown and birthplace to your guild hall. You must be inside your hall for it to work.
* The following money commands accept multiple arguments for "money" and * the coin type is determined by the first letter only. So a valid * example would be: "10 plat 2 gc 3 s 5 copper".
society fine name money soc f Wrong 20 p 10 sc -issues a fine of 20 platinum and 10 silver coins to member Wrong of the association. soc f Wrong -30 plat -subtracts 30 plat from the debt Wrong has. If he has less than 30 p debts, then his debt is set to zero. soc f all 20 gold -issues a fine of 20 gold (for example as membership fee) to everybody. Note that one can fine only lower ranks, so in truth this would give only fines to all lower ranks.
society deposit money soc d 12 platinum 30 cc -deposits 12 plat and 30 copper into the association account. Any debts the member has are lessened accordingly. This subcommand can be used by applicants to pay an entrance fee.
society withdraw money soc w 100 plat -withdraws 100 platinum coins from the association account.
society title name new_title soc t billybob CornHusker Supreme -sets BillyBob's 'rank' title to CornHusker Supreme. this title is never overwritten by new rank titles as long as the "no title change" toggle is set (see below). this command can only be used by guild leaders (to title other players), or deputies and officers (to title themselves).
society toggle_title_flag soc g -toggles your 'no title change' flag
